newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria oil refinery repair costs said over $1 bln.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria oil refinery repair costs said over $1 bln.

text.p: Nigerian Petroleum Minister Dan Etete said it would take more than $1 billion to keep oil refineries running at levels that would prevent fuel shortages, local newspapers reported on Tuesday.

The newspapers quoted Etete as saying $859 million plus 13 billion naira spread over a period of 18 months would be needed to keep refineries running at 85 percent of their installed capacity of 445,000 barrels per day (bpd).
"For efficient performance, maintenance must be timely. They (the refineries) need to be revamped in order to remain operational," Etete said,

He repeated an earlier complaint that the $230 million budgeted for refineries in 1997 was not paid and he complained about the crude oil allocation to refineries of 250,000 bpd, which he said was too low.
Nigeria, despite being a major crude oil producer, suffers frequent periods of fuel shortage and has had to import fuel to meet domestic demand because the four ailing refineries are unable to cope.
Etete suggested that the refineries' margins from the sale of petroleum products could be increased to 5.67 naira per litre from the current 2.00 naira per litre.
